title: countable & uncountable nouns
description: Het doel van deze les is om de leerlingen te leren wanneer ze ''much'' of ''many'' moeten gebruiken in een zin. Deze les is bedoeld voor 3 VMBO GL/TL leerlingen, A2/ B1 niveau.

license.name: CC Naamsvermelding 4.0 Internationale licentie

items.content: In today's lesson we will discuss what countable and uncountable nouns are. It is important to know the difference between the two since each of them has a different determiner. We will practise this topic by doing two exercises and eventually you will be qualified enough to do the test.

The aims of today's lesson are:

  • At the end of this lesson you will have learnt when to use 'much' or 'many' within a sentence.
  • At the end of this lesson you will be able to explain the differences between countable and uncountable nouns.
The following video will give you a brief instruction on countable and uncountable nouns. Carefully watch the entire video and feel free to pause if you feel like it's going too fast for you.

Now let's practise!

Do you feel like you have understood the instructions on the previous slide completely? Then you are free to challenge yourself with the two following exercises which will help you towards the last final test!

Have you finished both exercises with less than 4 mistakes? That's great! Because that means you are ready for the test.

Good luck!

Did you have more than 4 mistakes within the 2 exercises? Don't worry it's okay this wasn't the final test yet! Take a look at the instructions and come back to do the exercises again, later you can give the test a try.

Good luck, you got this!

introduction.body: Decide whether the nouns are countable or uncountable then fill in the blanks choose from: much or many.

content.body:
coffee children

computers luck

ideas clips

traffic flowers

sugar time
Countable nouns are indicated with many and uncountable nouns are indicated with much.
Countable nouns are indicated with many and uncountable nouns are indicated with much.

introduction.body: Use much or many to complete the sentences correctly.

content.body:
1. There is too sugar in my tea.

2. There are books in the library that you could use.

3. websites like this are helpful to study English.

4. I have too free time after school.

5. How people are invited to Lisa's party tonight?

6. Dad's birthday cake had so candles on it.

7. I've heard that eating eggs is healthy for you.

8. How flour do you need to bake those brownies?

9. I don't think I have that money to buy that game.

10. How pets do you have?

questions.label: Fill in the gaps to make the sentences correct.

content.body: Countable nouns are indicated with many and uncountable nouns are indicated with much.
Countable nouns are indicated with many and uncountable nouns are indicated with much.

items.content:
This is the third exercise in which you have to guess if the following sentences are correct or incorrect. You have to pay attention to the words ''many'' and ''much'' and if they fit in the sentence.

Now click on ''A quiz on Kahoot'' and do the quiz.

If you have more than 4 mistakes then take a look at the instructions and do the test later again.

GOOD LUCK!
